div.div: "Vice" is just the most recent media crew McAfee has latched onto. And if the past is prologue, it won’t go well. The chummy relationship McAfee tends to enjoy with his contacts in the media almost always goes south.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11Nc4Wb&via=Digg&text=How John McAfee Got Caught

div.a: Kevin Clash’s Accusers Speak Out About Sex With Elmo Puppeteer

div.div: Three men have come forward to accuse "Sesame Street" puppeteer Kevin Clash of having sex with them when they were minors. Now, two of them tell their stories.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TJusLQ&via=Digg&text=Kevin Clash’s Accusers Speak Out About Sex With Elmo Puppeteer

div.a: Your Face Reveals Risk Of Heart Attack

div.div: The visible signs of ageing in your face can reveal your risk of suffering a heart attack.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11Yl7Tp&via=Digg&text=Your Face Reveals Risk Of Heart Attack

div.div: BODY PILLOWS NOW OUT OF WORK

div.a: A Website In Japan Lets You Rent A Boyfriend For $364

div.div: Soine-ya Prime is a dispatch service where women can hire a handsome young man to lay with her in bed for a night.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VppEIS&via=Digg&text=A Website In Japan Lets You Rent A Boyfriend For $364

div.a: This Company Wants To Fly You To The Moon For $1.4 Billion

div.div: A group of space veterans and big-name backers today took the wraps off a commercial space venture that aims to send paying passengers to the moon and back at an estimated price of $1.4 billion or more for two.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TMvmFn&via=Digg&text=This Company Wants To Fly You To The Moon For $1.4 Billion

div.a: A McDonald's Mansion In New Hyde Park, NY

div.div: The most unusual McDonald's location on U.S. soil can be found in New Hyde Park, New York, where the franchise opened its doors in a gorgeous Georgian mansion that dates back to 1795.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SycN8P&via=Digg&text=A McDonald's Mansion In New Hyde Park, NY

div.div: How Google accidentally built a truly beloved social network, only to steamroll it with Google+. The sad, surprising story of Google Reader.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WMjHH5&via=Digg&text=Google's Lost Social Network

div.a: The Video Game Bug Is Truly Terrifying

div.div: Ack! With this new horrifying glitch, Phantasy Star Online 2 has discovered a new level of hell. Character skins can accidentally change... for the worse. The much, much worse. *shudder*

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vlr9rN&via=Digg&text=The Video Game Bug Is Truly Terrifying

div.div: SO 'THE DEVIL WEARS PRADA' WAS RIGHT?
"When I started in 1992, I really thought the Vogue fashion department was one of the most frightening places on the planet," says editor Hamish Bowles.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VmMEbH&via=Digg&text='Vogue' Editors Are 'Infinitely Less Scary' Nowadays

div.a: America Is Finally Closing Prisons. Now What Do We Do With Them?

div.div: We may be entering a new phase of America's complex relationship to incarceration, one in which we now have to figure out what to do with all these empty, peculiar and often isolated buildings.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YRF5Af&via=Digg&text=America Is Finally Closing Prisons. Now What Do We Do With Them?

div.a: John McAfee Rushed To Hospital After Apparent Heart Attack In Prison

div.div: Just hours after Guatemala's government denied John McAfee asylum, the rogue anti-virus pioneer was sent to a hospital there Thursday afternoon for a possible heart attack.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TMK27m&via=Digg&text=John McAfee Rushed To Hospital After Apparent Heart Attack In Prison

div.a: The Amazing Forensic Tech Behind The Next Apple, Samsung Legal Dustup

div.div: Apple’s latest billion-dollar lawsuit relies on a little-known technology called predictive coding. Here’s how it works — and why every company should learn to use it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RaSAsG&via=Digg&text=The Amazing Forensic Tech Behind The Next Apple, Samsung Legal Dustup

div.a: Why Super-Fast Internet Connections Are Somewhat Disappointing

div.div: Gigabit broadband is becoming available in a few select areas of the world. But does that really matter if other areas of the internet are incapable of keeping up?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TElbSO&via=Digg&text=Why Super-Fast Internet Connections Are Somewhat Disappointing

div.a: The Tiny Robot Precursor To Actual Transformers

div.div: A tiny robot capable of bending and flexing into a huge range of shapes could pave the way for real-life Transformers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VnaMKM&via=Digg&text=The Tiny Robot Precursor To Actual Transformers

div.a: This Is What Ten McDonald's Burgers Combined Into One Looks Like

div.div: In case you were wondering, this is what ten McDonald's burgers mashed into one looks like.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vml1PT&via=Digg&text=This Is What Ten McDonald's Burgers Combined Into One Looks Like

div.a: Apple Hires Hacker Who Helped Save Windows From Security Hell

div.div: Apple has hired a noted computer security researcher who helped Microsoft lock down its Windows operating system.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RaPNQn&via=Digg&text=Apple Hires Hacker Who Helped Save Windows From Security Hell

div.a: Botnet Steals $47M By Infecting PCs, Android And BlackBerry Devices

div.div: Security firm Check Point has unearthed a new case study detailing how more than $47 million was stolen from more than 30,000 corporate and private banking customers across Europe.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YBGH2f&via=Digg&text=Botnet Steals $47M By Infecting PCs, Android And BlackBerry Devices

div.a: When Should Photographers Drop Their Cameras

div.div: A newspaper cover showing a man seconds before his death has been widely criticised. When tragedy strikes, do photographers - professional or otherwise - have a duty to intervene?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TTOOzp&via=Digg&text=When Should Photographers Drop Their Cameras

div.a: Watch This Knife Get Tossed Out Of An Airplane

div.div: After watching the shiny knife plummet from the sky toward the ground, the horizon flipping wildly in the background, the first question from the audience was, naturally, “Did you find it?”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QKCzID&via=Digg&text=Watch This Knife Get Tossed Out Of An Airplane

div.a: When People Move To New York, Where Do They Go?

div.div: According to the American Community Survey, "the most detailed portrait of America's towns and neighborhoods" issued by the U.S. Census Bureau, many of New York City's newest residents are settling in Manhattan.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VHeRfg&via=Digg&text=When People Move To New York, Where Do They Go?

div.a: Why Does Every Company Have Its Own CIA Now?

div.div: Hotel chains, cruise lines, airlines, theme parks, banks, chemical companies, consumer products manufacturers, pharmaceutical companies, and even tech giants have been developing in-house intelligence units that look and act a lot like the CIA.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SO7jGF&via=Digg&text=Why Does Every Company Have Its Own CIA Now?

div.a: What Would The Christmas Tree At Rockefeller Center Be Worth?

div.div: You can’t put a price on Christmas spirit. An 80-foot Christmas tree with a 9½-foot crystal star and LED lights a-twinkle? That’s a different story.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R8W6ni&via=Digg&text=What Would The Christmas Tree At Rockefeller Center Be Worth?

div.div: DON'T BE QUITE SO QUICK TO BLAME

div.a: Why We're Not Always Good Samaritans

div.div: When it comes to good Samaritan acts, especially in a situation like the photographer who failed to rescue a pedestrian from an oncoming train in New York City, a variety of factors come into play.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RCsz5u&via=Digg&text=Why We're Not Always Good Samaritans

div.a: How To Say 'Google' In Every Language (Almost)

div.div: Since Google the verb—as in "to Google" something—officially entered the American lexicon in 2006 (Merriam Webster and the Oxford English Dictionary), other languages have followed suit, co-opting the active version of the word.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SJjplX&via=Digg&text=How To Say 'Google' In Every Language (Almost)

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TM9TMC&via=Digg&text=The 12 Best Print Ads Of 2012

div.div: Apple has a serious problem: in this era of deep social- and web-service integration, their products don’t “just work” nearly as often as they used to.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TRgSDD&via=Digg&text=Rethinking The iPhone Lockscreen

div.div: This kid is going to be so confused when his parents explain how he was conceived.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11KQ9yW&via=Digg&text=An Extremely Creative Way To Document Your Pregnancy

div.a: The Best Office Chair You Can Buy

div.div: 14,000 hours. If you've got a desk job, that's the minimum amount of time you'll spend sitting over the next ten years. So yes, it's worth spending some time and money getting the best office chair.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QBOFDV&via=Digg&text=The Best Office Chair You Can Buy

div.a: Why Are We Obsessed With The Apocalypse?

div.div: Fears that the world will end on 21 December are rife, despite there being no evidence. So, why are we so fixated with end of the world theories?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TTwRRp&via=Digg&text=Why Are We Obsessed With The Apocalypse?

div.div: Here are few of the key statistics of two-and-a-half season’s worth of undead mayhem.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VnQ7qa&via=Digg&text='The Walking Dead' By The Numbers

div.a: The Algorithm That Decides Which Terrorists Should Be Eliminated First

div.div: Paulo Shakarian has an algorithm that might one day help dismantle al-Qaida — or at least one of its lesser affiliates.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XtPl1d&via=Digg&text=The Algorithm That Decides Which Terrorists Should Be Eliminated First

div.div: We raise our kids to be truthful. We teach them about the laws of physics. And then we tell them that nine flying reindeer pull an immortal fat man and his sleigh through the sky so that he can deliver gifts to millions of kids around the world one night a year. Is it bad that we lie to our kids about Santa?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11KfKIg&via=Digg&text=The Santa Lie

div.a: Things You Thought You Knew About Physics But Really Don't

div.div: What if you thought the earth was flat? And then you found out it isn't?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vp72Zp&via=Digg&text=Things You Thought You Knew About Physics But Really Don't

div.a: Brazil Prison Gang Conducted 10-Hour Conference Call

div.div: A 10-hour conference call that gang members hosted from inside a Sao Paulo jail highlights how gang leaders in Brazil are able to directly conduct their "business" from the safety of their prison cells.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QHFBgP&via=Digg&text=Brazil Prison Gang Conducted 10-Hour Conference Call
